Oxymorphone (Opana)

Legal Status

by Erowid

U.S. FEDERAL LAW #

Caution : All legal information should be verified through other sources. [see below]

U.S. FEDERAL LEGAL SUMMARY Oxymorphone REGULATED Yes STATUS Scheduled SCHEDULE Schedule II CLASSIFICATION Opioid


                    Context: 
                    This excerpt provides detailed legal and regulatory information about oxymorphone (Opana), including U.S. federal law classification as Schedule II and opioid status, along with advisories on verifying legal details and related resources. It is part of the broader "Pharms" section of the Erowid website, which catalogs substance profiles, legal statuses, and reference materials critical for users researching psychoactive substances.

metadata.title: Erowid Oxymorphone (Opana) Vault : Legal Status
metadata.description: Information on the legal status of Oxymorphone (Opana).

content:
Drug: Oxymorphone | cid: 5284604
Source: erowid | Source description: Information on the legal status of Oxymorphone (Opana).
Erowid name: oxymorphone
Category: PHARMS
Field: Law

                    Text: 
                    U.S. FEDERAL LEGAL SUMMARY Oxymorphone REGULATED Yes STATUS Scheduled SCHEDULE Schedule II CLASSIFICATION Opioid

Oxymorphone is Schedule II in the U.S. This means it is illegal to sell without a DEA license and illegal to buy or possess without a license or prescription.

INTERNATIONAL LAW #

If you have information about the legal status of this substance in any other country, please let us know.

CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #

Erowid legal information is a summary of data gathered from site visitors, government documents, websites, and other resources. We are not lawyers and can not guarantee the accuracy of the information provided here. We do our best to keep this information correct and up-to-date, but laws are complex and constantly changing. Laws may also vary from one jurisdiction to another (county, state, country, etc)...this list is not comprehensive.

RELATED RESOURCES #

RELATED LINKS #

None

                    Context: 
                    This excerpt provides the U.S. federal legal classification and regulatory status for oxymorphone (Opana), including its Schedule II designation and legal restrictions. It is part of the detailed legal and pharmacological information section within the broader Erowid database, which covers drug laws, classifications, and related regulations across various substances.
